MAGNUM PHOTOS

The artist Coco Capitán, born in 1992, has curated works from Magnum's archive centered on the theme of cats. Coco, an artist with global recognition for her photography and handwritten aphorisms, pairs her quotes with each cat-themed photo, crafting a collection that tells new stories through each feline motif.


© Coco Capitán 2025
© Magnum Photos

items.longDescription:
Lee Ufan

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

Lee Ufan was born in South Korea and lives and works worldwide, based in Japan and Paris. His works are characterized by a sense of infinity through the restriction of colour and action. In his work ‘From Line’, he uses the monochromatic colour blue. “At the beginning, it will appear dark and thick, then it will get gradually thinner and finally disappear,” said the artist.

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024
items.name: TATE UT(Short Sleeve Graphic T-shirt)
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean, Tumble dry low.

items.longDescription:
Fahrelnissa Zeid

Curated by Tate

Tate is a family of four art galleries: Tate Britain, Tate Modern, Tate Liverpool, Tate St Ives. We care for and display the national collection of modern and contemporary art from around the world and British art from 1500 to today. UT and Tate have chosen works by artists in Tate’s collection who express themselves through paint. Let this UT series curated by Tate inspire you to get creative.

Zeid made this painting when she was living in London in the 1950s. In 1949, she had taken her first transatlantic flight and was captivated by the abstract perspective of aerial views. She later translated their scale and feeling into the whirling shapes that appear in this painting. A divisionist effect is achieved, whereby individual patches of colour are built up to create an overall composition.

© Cy Twombly Foundation, © Tate 2024

items.longDescription:
"Dove of Peace" 1949

Pablo Picasso

As one of the most influential artists of the 20th century, Pablo Picasso has shaped contemporary art and continues to inspire generations to come. His career spanned painting, sculpture, printmaking, ceramics, and stage design. For this collection, his first collaboration, four carefully selected paintings have been incorporated into T-shirts.

Pablo Picasso
Painter, sculptor, and printmaker born in Málaga, Spain. In 1900 at age nineteen, Picasso made his first visit to Paris, where he was based from 1904 through the 1940s. In this city of art and culture, he made the acquaintances of Henri Matisse and Georges Braque, who vastly influenced his creative practice. Paris is also where he spent his formative “Blue Period” and “Rose Period” and became known as a founder of the Cubist movement which fundamentally revamped the way that objects are perceived. Historic feats like Les Demoiselles d’Avignon and Guernica combine creative spirit and political messaging into a form that is quint-essentially Picasso. His endless search for new modes of expression led him beyond the world of painting into the realms of sculpture, ceramics, literature and music, leaving a deep impression across the whole of modern art.

La Colombe de la Paix, 1950 © Succession Picasso 2025 / Bridgeman Images

Pablo Picasso

As one of the most influential artists of the 20th century, Pablo Picasso has shaped contemporary art and continues to inspire generations to come. His career spanned painting, sculpture, printmaking, ceramics, and stage design. For this collection, his first collaboration, four carefully selected paintings have been incorporated into T-shirts.

Pablo Picasso
Painter, sculptor, and printmaker born in Málaga, Spain. In 1900 at age nineteen, Picasso made his first visit to Paris, where he was based from 1904 through the 1940s. In this city of art and culture, he made the acquaintances of Henri Matisse and Georges Braque, who vastly influenced his creative practice. Paris is also where he spent his formative “Blue Period” and “Rose Period” and became known as a founder of the Cubist movement which fundamentally revamped the way that objects are perceived. Historic feats like Les Demoiselles d’Avignon and Guernica combine creative spirit and political messaging into a form that is quint-essentially Picasso. His endless search for new modes of expression led him beyond the world of painting into the realms of sculpture, ceramics, literature and music, leaving a deep impression across the whole of modern art.

Nature morte à la Guitare, 1922 © Succession Picasso 2025 / Bridgeman Images

When using a washing machine, select a cold temperature setting and cycle with lowest spin. No Tumbler/Dryer.
Remove your linen quickly from washer.
Adjust it to cut down wrinkles by hand.
Hang it to dry in the shade using a hanger. Avoid direct sunlight.

items.longDescription:
Disney in Blue

BUAISOU, an indigo dyer and farmer collective known for blending tradition with modern craftsmanship, has garnered worldwide attention. Inspired by the rich hues of natural indigo, UNIQLO has launched an exclusive collection featuring Mickey Mouse and his friends as its motifs. Enjoy this beautiful lineup of blues crafted from the finest indigo. Note: The products use synthetic dyes inspired by natural indigo.

BUAISOU
Founded in 2015 and based in Kamiita Town, Tokushima Prefecture, BUAISOU manages the entire indigo dyeing process—from cultivating indigo and producing the dye material, "sukumo," to crafting the final products— traditionally carried out by separate artisans. In addition to creating original indigo-dyed items and collaborating with others, they also participate in exhibitions and workshops both in Japan and abroad,sharing the beauty of natural indigo through various methods.

©Disney
items.name: Disney in Blue Shorts

features.text: High-performance outerwear for changeable weather. Windproof with a comfortable mesh lining.

Functional fabric with a windproof laminated film. Water-repellent finish protects against light rain. Without perfluorinated chemicals (PFAS). *The fabric is coated with a water-repellent agent so the effect lasts longer. The finish is not permanent. Moderately crisp, wrinkled texture goes well with sporty and casual styles.
The hood rolls up inside the collar.
Waist pockets plus practical inner pockets.
Drawstring in the hem allows you to adjust the fit.
